titleproper.value: Guide to the Collection of Spanish Civil War Postcards <num>ALBA.242</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Tamiment staff, with further editing by Jasmine Sykes-Kunk in 2019

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-02-22T20:36:12</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

extent.value: in 2 manuscript boxes, 1 half manuscript box, and 3 binders

abstract.value: This collection is comprised of two different, but related groups of postcards and trading cards about the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939). The use of visual propaganda to garner support was an instrumental and influential strategy employed by both factions.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Collection of Spanish Civil War Postcards; ALBA 242; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
There is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials. The accession numbers associated with these items are 2001.005 and 2019.016.

More than 400 postcards (both black and white and color; with both graphic and photographic images) dating from or related to the Spanish Civil War arranged in three binders. In addition to the main collection of original postcards there is a small box of reproduction cards.

subject.value: Nationalism and art -- Spain -- History -- 20th century
Art -- Political aspects -- Spain -- History -- 20th century

corpname.value: Unión General de Trabajadores de España
